post_text: Beginning Tuesday, September 15, 2020, our 5th grade students will rotate classrooms in a similar fashion to the rest of the middle school. Students will still be using the dividers on their desks, along with their masks and sit near the same students in each classroom for consistency and protection.

More details on the ticketing process will be coming soon!

2019-2020 CMS Yearbook is FREE for ALL students!!

Due to the unfortunate way we are ending this school year, CMS has partnered with Interstate Studios to create a unique yearbook for all of our students to commemorate this year by looking at all of the positives our students were able to experience! This will certainly be a year to remember and we want to focus on the good! There will be no order form, as all students will receive a copy of the yearbook upon returning for the 2020-2021 school year paid for by the PTO and CMS Principal’s Fund! We would typically be putting out an order form at this time and we did not want anyone to think they missed a deadline as we will be ordering 1 book per student currently enrolled at no cost to families! Thank you to Interstate Studios and PTO for helping to make this possible!

Dear Rebel Nation,

The spread of the Corona-Virus has many people extremely concerned across the globe . I am old enough to remember other infectious diseases that have caused community and global concern. They have ranged from Swine Flu, H1N1, Legioneer's disease, Meningitis etc. What has changed since those diseases visited the globe is the growth of information through apps and social media. However, the most reliable medical information will come from the CDC.I have included a direct link that is updated daily.

https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html.

My hope is that you will find comfort in knowing the facts. We will work to align our recommendations with and follow guidelines from the Center for Disease Control and Prevention, the Ohio Department of Health as well as local guidance from our own County Health Department, and the Governors' Office.

Presale ticketing ends on Thursday, March 19th at midnight. A portion of all proceeds will be donated to the effort to restore the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, France.

Beginning Monday October 7, 2019 you might see a bus delivering students home at 6:15 or 7:00 PM. You might be wondering what is going on? Crestview has been awarded a grant for an after school program. The program has the potential to be in place for at least five years. Busing is included in this 21st century grant.

Since we do not normally see a bus with flashers in the evening, we remind everyone to observe the flashers and STOP, so that our kids are safe. Thank you for being safe drivers. We have about 50 elementary students in the program and over 25 will be riding a school bus home in the evening.

We are grateful for this opportunity that does not use tax payer dollars! It is truly a gift to enrich and intervene with our youth!

The cost of the program is FREE for Grades K - 5 students! Students will receive a snack daily and work on Homework, Reading and Math, STEAM, Fine Arts, and Wellness. This is a hands-on program.
